==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}
[[File:Deer running.jpg|thumb|240px|鹿]]

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – a deer. Current form is highly abstracted – legs have transformed to {{zh-l|*比}} – note grouping of front and rear legs, which are bent – head has transformed to middle component (similar to {{zh-l|*凸}}/{{zh-l|*曲}}), while antlers on top and extended lip/mouth on left transformed into {{zh-l|*广}}. This simplification occurred during seal characters.

Contrast the very different development of {{zh-l|*馬|horse}}, and the hybrid simplification in {{zh-l|*𢊁|bison}} (as in {{zh-l|*薦}}), which has the head of {{lang|zh|鹿}} but the legs of {{lang|zh|馬}} ({{zh-l|*灬}}).

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|しか}}
{{IPAchar|/seka/}} → {{IPAchar|/sika/}}

Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しか|夫|tr1=se|t1=male|鹿|tr2=ka|t2=deer}}, in contrast to {{m|ja|女鹿||tr=meka|female deer|pos=archaic}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|しか|acc=0|dev=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK|acc2=2|acc2_ref=DJR,NHK|a=Ja-Sika.oga}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しか}}

# [[deer]]
#: {{ja-usex|奈良公園には'''鹿'''しかいない。|^なら こうえん に は '''しか''' しか いない。|There is nothing but '''deer''' in Nara Park.}}

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|鹿を逐う者は山を見ず|しか を お.う もの は やま を みず}}: “someone chasing a deer doesn't see the mountain” → a metaphor for how someone who is fixed on a target can be oblivious to the challenges in the way
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かせぎ}}
From the resemblance to a {{m|ja|桛木||tr=kasegi|cross-shaped spindle; a branching point in a tree}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かせぎ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かせぎ}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=かせぎ}} [[deer]]
#* '''1212''': [[w:Hōjōki|Hōjōki]]
#*: {{ja-usex|山鳥のほろと鳴くを聞きても、父か母かと疑ひ、峰の'''かせぎ'''の近くなれたるにつけても、世に遠ざかるほどを知る。|^やまどり の ほろ と なく を ききて も、 ちち か はは か と うたがひ、 みね の '''かせぎ''' の ちかく なれたる に つけて も、 よ に とおざかる ほど をしる。|Hearing the ''horo'' call of the mountain pheasant, wondering if it were my father or mother [calling from beyond the grave], and seeing how the '''deer''' on the ridge are so tame that they come close by, all of it shows me how far away I am from the world.}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かのしし}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かのしし|鹿|tr1=ka|t1=deer|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle|肉|tr3=しし|t3=meat, flesh}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かのしし}}

====Alternative forms====

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かのしし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かのしし|archaic}} [[deer]]

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|しし}}
From {{m|ja|肉|tr=shishi||meat, flesh}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|しし|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|獣}}, {{ja-l|猪}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しし|archaic}} a [[beast]] {{qualifier|used for its meat, such as a [[boar]] or a [[deer]]}}
# short for {{m|ja|猪武者|tr=inoshishi musha}}: a [[reckless]] [[warrior]]
# short for {{m|ja|鹿狩り|tr=shishi-gari}}: a deer [[hunter]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=しし|slang}} a [[female]] [[attendant]] at a [[bathhouse]] or [[hot spring]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=しし|slang|archaic}} a female [[prostitute]] at a [[bathhouse]] or [[hot spring]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''beast'' sense is more commonly spelled {{ja-l|獣}}.

{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ろく}}

{{ja-pron|yomi=o|ろく|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}
